solution_line_template: There are {ounces_per_pound} ounces in one pound, and thus in {pounds_of_meat} pounds of meat mix there are {pounds_of_meat}*{ounces_per_pound}=<<{pounds_of_meat}*{ounces_per_pound}={total_ounces_initial}>>{total_ounces_initial} ounces of sausage meat.

Thus, the {initial_links} sausage links contained {total_ounces_initial} ounces of meat, or {total_ounces_initial}/{initial_links}=<<{total_ounces_initial}/{initial_links}={ounces_per_link}>>{ounces_per_link} ounces per link.
If Brandy ate {eaten_links} links, then {initial_links}-{eaten_links}=<<{initial_links}-{eaten_links}={remaining_links}>>{remaining_links} links remained.

Thus, {remaining_links} remaining links, at {ounces_per_link} ounces per link, contained {remaining_links}*{ounces_per_link}=<<{remaining_links}*{ounces_per_link}={remaining_ounces}>>{remaining_ounces} ounces of meat.
